intro: Kleinia eupapposa, commonly known as the Cape fuchsia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments. It has a low, spreading growth habit with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Kleinia eupapposa is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
